title: Chile's president shakes up Cabinet, replaces five ministers
description: Chilean President Gabriel Boric has shaken up his Cabinet, replacing five of his 24 ministers on the eve of beginning his second year in power

title: Russia’s hypersonic missile attack on Ukraine highlights Western vulnerability
description: The advanced missiles had little real impact on the Ukraine conflict. But they have renewed alarm over the Kremlin’s sophisticated arsenal, and that Putin possesses difficult-to-intercept, nuclear-capable weapons that the United States and its allies do not yet have and cannot defend against.

title: Eastern Congo hit by rebel attacks; 45 civilians killed
description: Local authorities say the death toll from several attacks this week by extremist rebels in eastern Congo has risen to at least 45 people

title: German church reform assembly calls for same-sex blessings
description: A meeting between Germany’s Catholic bishops and lay representatives agreed Friday to call for the church to approve blessings of same-sex unions

title: France and Britain seek to repair ties in first summit in five years
description: Their biggest announcement was a deal on illegal migration and border security but it is clear the two leaders want to put the post-Brexit animosity behind them.

title: Kenya jails 7 foreigners for life over drug trafficking
description: Six Pakistanis and one Iranian national who were found guilty of trying to smuggle heroin to Kenya’s coastal city of Mombasa via the Indian Ocean have been sentenced to life in prison

title: Female and nonbinary swimmers can go topless in public pools, Berlin says
description: Berlin’s swimming pool rules will now apply equally to men and women who want to go topless. Germans generally have a relaxed attitude to public nudity, experts say.

title: Timeline of shooting at Jehovah's Witnesses hall in Germany
description: A timeline of the shooting at a Jehovah’s Witnesses hall in the German city of Hamburg on Thursday evening, according to information provided by authorities on Friday

title: Iran and Saudi Arabia set to restore ties after mediation by China
description: Saudi Arabia severed diplomatic relations with Iran in 2016 after the Saudi embassy in Tehran was attacked and burned by Iranian protesters.

title: Haiti police pursue new suspects in presidential slaying
description: Authorities in Haiti have identified new suspects in the July 2021 killing of President Jovenel Moïse

title: China condemns Japanese plan to release Fukushima water
description: China has condemned a plan by Japan to release treated radioactive wastewater from the damaged Fukushima nuclear plant into the sea, demanding that Tokyo first receive the approval of neighboring countries

title: Cypriot president pledges 2% of GDP on defense spending
description: The president of Cyprus says he will earmark 2% of gross domestic product to defense spending in line with other European Union member states as a means to strengthen the east Mediterranean island nation’s foreign policy bargaining power

title: Macron insists pension reform is needed, despite protests
description: French President Emmanuel Macron has written to labor unions insisting on the need to raise the retirement age from 62 to 64 in order to make the French pension system financially sustainable in the coming years

title: Senegal's ex-prime minister in custody after criticism
description: Senegal’s former prime minister was taken into custody after questioning the country’s president about funding a French politician during a recent visit

title: Iran says Saudi Arabia to resume relations after tensions
description: Iran says it has reached a deal with Saudi Arabia to resume diplomatic relations and reopen embassies in the two countries after years of tensions

title: UK has new Duke of Edinburgh as king gives his brother title
description: Britain’s King Charles III has made his youngest brother the Duke of Edinburgh, passing on a title held by their late father, Prince Philip

title: U.S. charity calls on Egypt to release hunger-striking poet
description: A U.S. charity has called on Egypt to release a well-known poet and songwriter who is on a hunger strike against his incarceration

title: Beijing air quality plummets amid dust storm, pollution
description: Skyscrapers in Beijing have disappeared into the haze and air quality plummeted as China’s capital is enveloped in a dust storm and heavy pollution

title: US trains West African militaries as jihadi threat spreads
description: As extremist violence in West Africa’s Sahel region spreads south toward coastal states, the United States military has launched its annual military training exercise which will help armies contain the jihadi threat

title: How Israeli forces fired repeatedly into a group of civilians
description: A Washington Post 3D analysis shows that Israeli forces inside a vehicle, while responding to an alleged gunman, fired at least 14 times into a group of Palestinian civilians — even after those people would have been visible.

title: Syria's Aleppo airport resumes flights days after airstrike
description: The head of Syria’s civil aviation says flights at the international airport in Aleppo have resumed, three days after it was put out of service by a suspected Israeli airstrike

title: Schools shut, drivers stuck as gales and blizzards batter UK
description: Trains have been canceled, schools shut and drivers stuck for hours as a blast of snow and wind hits Britain for the second time in a week

title: Germany searches for motive in Jehovah’s Witness shooting that killed 7
description: The German branch of the Jehovah's Witnesses called it a "horrific" attack while German Chancellor Olaf Scholz said it was a "brutal" and sent his condolences.

title: Palestinian suspect killed by Israeli fire in West Bank
description: The Israeli military says a Palestinian man who entered a settlement in the occupied West Bank armed with knives and explosive devices was shot and killed by an Israeli settler

title: Mexico rebukes GOP push to deploy U.S. military on cartels across border
description: President López Obrador cast the fentanyl epidemic as a U.S. problem and said the demands, made after the Matamoros kidnappings, were a threat to sovereignty.

title: French, British leaders meet in efforts to mend relations
description: French President Emmanuel Macron and British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak are to meet in Paris for a summit aimed at mending relations following post-Brexit tensions; improving military and business ties; and toughening efforts against Channel migrant crossings

title: French church abuse victims get reparations, and recognition
description: French victims of sexual abuse by priests are getting reparations at last — and most importantly, official recognition from the church of what happened to them

title: Papua rebels release videos showing kidnapped NZ pilot alive
description: Separatist rebels in Indonesia’s Papua province released more photos and videos Friday appearing to show the New Zealand pilot they took hostage last month alive

title: IS claim attack on senior Taliban governor in Afghanistan
description: The Islamic State group has claimed responsibility for killing the governor of Afghanistan’s northern Balkh province in a suicide bombing at his office

title: China’s new premier, a Xi loyalist, is caught between business and politics
description: Li Qiang, who oversaw the disastrous Shanghai lockdown, will become Chinese leader Xi Jinping's No. 2 on Saturday. Will he be a yes-man or could he influence policy?

title: Belgian strikes cut public services, snarl traffic
description: A nationwide strike by Belgium’s public sector is slowing rush-hour traffic and affecting everything from garbage collection to childcare

title: German police: 8 dead in Jehovah's Witnesses hall shooting
description: Police say eight people were killed in a shooting at a Jehovah’s Witnesses hall in Hamburg, apparently including the perpetrator

title: Ukraine live briefing: Russian missile threat still high; Ukraine war part of global decline in freedom, report says
description: Russia's attack, which included Kinzhal hypersonic weapons, killed at least nine. The Freedom House report says the war led to 'devastating human rights atrocities.'

title: East coast African states ail from too much, too little rain
description: In the east and Horn of Africa, a harrowing drought

title: Police crackdown on underage marriage in India leaves families in despair
description: At least 2,700 people, mostly men, have been arrested in the border state of Assam.

title: Traumatic stress, an invisible wound, hobbles Ukrainian soldiers
description: Traumatic stress, an invisible wound, hobbles Ukrainian soldiers

title: The Rohingya endure crisis after crisis
description: While still grappling with the traumas exacted upon them in Myanmar, the Rohingya refugees in Bangladesh are coping with new pressures.
